item.title: The Hardest Thing: Building and Running the UNIX Kernel from Original Sources
item.description: Dave takes you on an adventure where he builds and deploys the 2.11 BSD Kernel on a PDP-11/83.

item.title: Draw all roads in any city at once
item.description: This website allows you to select a city and then draws every single road on a screen.

item.title: AMD Launches A YouTube Channel For Developers
item.description: If you are looking for some interesting technical content to watch over the holidays or end-of-year downtime, AMD shared today that they have launched their own YouTube channel for developer-related content.

item.title: Propositional Logic
item.description: Propositional logic is the study of the inferential relationships among sentences. It focuses on the role of propositional connectives.
item.author: (https://facebook.com/antoniolupetti)

item.title: Feeling seen - Byte Tank
item.description: Celebration of external validation, and possible countermeasures

item.title: BSA’s new member model creates embarrassing membership loss
item.description: Scouting America (nee Boy Scouts of America) will likely have a large 2024 youth-membership loss. It's likely due to its new rolling-membership scheme. By December 31, 2024, BSA SA will likely have a 2.4% member loss. If nothing changes, it will reach 14% by April 2025! SA could have avoided this with a subscription model....

item.title: Carpalx - keyboard layout optimizer
item.description: Three fully optimized layouts are presented here. Each provides an optimial typing experience with a slightly different letter mask. Use of the pinky is reduced and hand alternation is increased over popular alternatives like Colemak.

item.title: Building Custom RSS Feeds for LWN.net
item.description: If you’ve spent a bit of time in the Linux community, especially anything kernel-related, you may be familiar with Linux Weekly News. It’s an invaluable resource for kernel development news, security updates, and general open source coverage. While they offer RSS for syndication, I found myself wanting more control over the feeds themselves - specifically, the ability to filter out subscriber-only articles.

item.title: The day I canceled my Spotify subscription
item.description: I used to be a big fan of Spotify. Today I cancelled my subscription.

item.description: Building an app in 80 hours to keep up with your DIY projects

item.description: The personal website of Mark Fayngersh

item.title: Lonely Weekends
item.description: A personal account of experiencing weekend loneliness during PhD studies, exploring how friend dynamics change with relationships, and discovering that committed relationships with family and partners are crucial for overcoming isolation and achieving success.

item.title: The Cherry Pick Ratio
item.description: Generative AI's 'Cherry Pick Ratio' measures how many outputs a user must generate to find a useful result, impacting user tolerance and adoption.
